qas.question: What is credited with the origins of the German identity?
How was early German culture developed?
What man is credited with the emergence of the German nation?
When did the popularity of the German nation increase?
What is credited with creating the Origins of a German identity?
Who developed the concept of a German Nation?
When did the popularity of a German identity arise?

answers.text: in the aftermath of the French Revolution

qas.question: What movement slowed the spread of a German identity?
What concept was developed by Martin Luther?

plausible_answers.text: Martin Luther, Johann Wolfgang von Goethe and Friedrich Schiller

qas.question: What literay and religious figures helped spread German culture in europe?

context: The event of the <a0_0><a4_0><b8_0>Protestant Reformation<b8_0/><a4_0/><a0_0/> and the politics that ensued has been cited as the origins of German identity that arose in response to the spread of a common German language and literature. Early German national culture was developed through <a1_0>literary and religious figures<a1_0/> including <b10_0>Martin Luther, Johann Wolfgang von Goethe and Friedrich Schiller<b10_0/>. The <b9_0>concept of a German nation<b9_0/> was developed by <a7_0>German philosopher<a7_0/> <a2_0><a5_0>Johann Gottfried Herder<a5_0/><a2_0/>. The popularity of German identity arose <a6_0>in the <a3_0>aftermath of the French Revolution<a6_0/><a3_0/>.
